source.72de37c8:
## install packages 
import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing
import os , glob 
import pandas_profiling # pandas profile 
from pandas_profiling import ProfileReport
import warnings 
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')
source.2da3ec70:
## engagment data 
path = '../input/learnplatform-covid19-impact-on-digital-learning/engagement_data' 
files = glob.glob(path + "/*.csv")

all_files = []

for filename in files:
    df = pd.read_csv(filename, index_col=None, header=0)
    district_id = filename.split("/")[4].split(".")[0]
    df["district_id"] = district_id
    all_files.append(df)
    
engagement_data = pd.concat(all_files)
engagement_data = engagement_data.reset_index(drop=True)

##Product information data
product_info = pd.read_csv("../input/learnplatform-covid19-impact-on-digital-learning/products_info.csv")
## districts information data 
districts_info = pd.read_csv("../input/learnplatform-covid19-impact-on-digital-learning/districts_info.csv")
source.4fddd918:
product_profile = ProfileReport(product_info, title="products data Report")
product_profile
source.cfdb98d8:
districts_profile = ProfileReport(districts_info, title="districts data Report")
districts_profile
source.d6b96d1e:
engagement_profile = ProfileReport(engagement_data, title="Engagement_data Report")
engagement_profile 
# it may take some time due dataset size
source.e2cf15dd: We will now generate the profile reports for our three data frames and see what we  get.
source.482faf03: <center> <h1> Basic EDA to kickstart your analysis project <h1><center>
source.a29a3732:
## About the notebook 
In this notebook we will use panda profiling to generate a simple but rich EDA with just one call for pandas ProfileReport. 
 For each column the following statistics - if relevant for the column type - are presented in an interactive HTML report:
* **Type inference**: detect the types of columns in a dataframe.
* **Essentials:** type, unique values, missing values.
* **Quantile statistics** like minimum value, Q1, median, Q3, maximum, range, interquartile range.
* **Descriptive statistics**like mean, mode, standard deviation, sum, median absolute deviation, coefficient of variation, kurtosis, skewness.
* **Most frequent values**.
* **Histogram**.
* **Correlations** of highly correlated variables, Spearman, Pearson and Kendall matrices
* **Missing values** matrix, count, heatmap and dendrogram of missing values
* **Text analysis** learn about categories (Uppercase, Space), scripts (Latin, Cyrillic) and blocks (ASCII) of text data.
* **File and Image analysis** extract file sizes, creation dates and dimensions and scan for truncated images or those containing EXIF information.
source.3777c692:
**What a time to be alive , right ?**

The pandas profiling package is a cool easy and rich tool which can be used to speed up your exploratory data analysis. although if you want to get your analysis skills to the next level and get valuable insights you should get your hands dirty with data.
source.7cf9e5d6: You can learn more about the pandas profiling at [ The documentation website ](https://pandas-profiling.github.io/pandas-profiling/docs/master/rtd/).
